entry.title: #70 GLUE v. 2.0 - XML Schema: change Doc root element name
entry.content:
hi all,
I have one suggestion for a small change for the glue2 XML rendering.
Since the Ldap rendering defines 'glue' as the root attribute in an RDN
string, similarly we could consider changing the Document Root element from '<Entities>'
to '<Glue>'. This is a v.minor change and would be more consistent with the ldap rendering.
What do you think?
David

entry.title: #70 GLUE v. 2.0 - XML Schema: 'ID' in element names
entry.content:
Elements that are used to refer to other entities end in 'ID', for example 'EndpointID' to identify an Endpoint associated with a Service. The type of these elements is glue:ID_t.

We may want to drop the 'ID' suffix since it is identifying the type of the element and this isn't something we are doing for other elements.

Abstract:

The GLUE 2 specification is an information model for Grid entities described in natural
language enriched with a graphical representation using UML Class Diagrams. This
document presents a realization of this information model as XML Schema.
